data.name: Archer
data.description:
Cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Battering Ram
data.description:

+ High health
- Takes bonus damage from melee attacks
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Demolition Ship
data.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

data.name: Prelate
data.description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Automatically inspires Villagers to greatly improve their gather rate. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites starting in the Castle Age (III).
+ Heals friendly units
- Low health

variations.description:

+ Heals friendly units
- Low health

data.name: Trade Ship
data.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
- No combat

variations.description:

data.name: Trader
data.description: Traders generate Gold when assigned to trade with a Trade Post or another players Market. The distance between the trade target and Market determines the amount of Gold. Once assigned to trade, the Trader makes repeated trips between its Home Market and the trade target. You can assign a new Home Market if you wish to.

variations.name: Trader
variations.description: Traders generate Gold when assigned to trade with a Trade Post or another players Market. The distance between the trade target and Market determines the amount of Gold. Once assigned to trade, the Trader makes repeated trips between its Home Market and the trade target. You can assign a new Home Market if you wish to.

- No combat
